text: William Henry Marling,JP, DL (1 July 1835 – 19 October 1919)'Sir William Marling' The Times (London, England), October 21, 1919, Issue 42236, p.15. was an English baronet.wikitree ==Early life== Marling was born in Stroud;,National Archives the son of Sir Samuel Marling. He was educated at Trinity College, Cambridge.Alumni Cantabrigienses: A Biographical List of All Known Students, Graduates and Holders of Office at the University of Cambridge, from the Earliest Times to 1900, John Venn/John Archibald Venn Cambridge University Press > (10 volumes 1922 to 1953) Part II. 1209-1751 Vol. iv. Kahlenberg – Oyler, (1947) p364 > (10 volumes 1922 to 1953) Part I. 1209-1751 Vol. iii. Kaile – Ryves, (1924) p320] ==Marriage== Marling married Mary Abraham in 1860: they had four sons.thePeerage.com ==Succession== Marling succeeded his father in 1883; and was succeeded by his son in 1919. ==County office== Marling was appointed High Sheriff of Gloucestershire in 1888.THE SHERIFFS FOR 1888.The Morning Post (London, England), Monday, March 19, 1888; pg. 3; Issue 36115 ==References== Category:1835 births Category:1919 deaths Category:People from Stroud District Category:Baronets in the Baronetage of the United Kingdom Category:High Sheriffs of Gloucestershire Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Cambridge Category:Justices of the peace
title: William Marling
